blogPosts.title: Getting Started with Svelte
blogPosts.content: Svelte is a modern JavaScript framework that takes a unique approach to building user interfaces. Unlike traditional frameworks that do the bulk of their work in the browser, Svelte shifts that work into a compile step that happens when you build your app. This results in highly efficient, fast-running applications with a smaller footprint...

blogPosts.title: Advanced TypeScript Techniques
blogPosts.content: TypeScript, a typed superset of JavaScript, offers powerful features that can greatly enhance your development experience. In this post, we'll explore some advanced TypeScript techniques that can help you write more robust and maintainable code...

blogPosts.title: Building Responsive Layouts with Tailwind CSS
blogPosts.content: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that allows you to rapidly build custom user interfaces. One of its strengths is how easy it makes creating responsive layouts. In this tutorial, we'll walk through the process of building a responsive layout using Tailwind CSS...

recentNews.title: Svelte 4 Released
recentNews.summary: The Svelte team has announced the release of Svelte 4, bringing performance improvements and new features.
recentNews.content: Svelte 4 has been released, introducing significant performance improvements and several new features. The update includes better TypeScript support, improved hydration, and a smaller runtime...

recentNews.title: TypeScript 5.1 Now Available
recentNews.summary: Microsoft has released TypeScript 5.1 with new features and improvements.
recentNews.content: TypeScript 5.1 is now available, bringing several new features and improvements. This release includes better inference for tagged template strings, a new 'unspecified' type, and various performance enhancements...
